node.title: Super Bowl celebrations get rowdy in L.A.
node.description: Police issue dispersal orders, one person shot, fireworks set off on streets, some looting reported after Rams beat Bengals

node.title: Ukraine seeks meeting with Russia within 48 hours
node.description: Ukraine is accusing Russia of ignoring requests to explain its troop build-up, and calls for a meeting.

node.title: Main U.S.-Canada bridge reopens after police clear protesters
node.description: The Ambassador Bridge was blocked for nearly a week by anti-vaccine mandate demonstrators, but in Canada's capital of Ottawa, protests were growing and tempers flaring.

node.title: Anti-mandate protest: Police planning for every contingency
node.description: Police say working collaboratively with anti-vaccine mandate protesters outside Parliament may be the best way to reduce disruption.

node.title: Star Russian figure skater can keep competing at Games, court rules
node.description: U.S. Olympic officials say they're disappointed; Court in part blamed 15-year-old Kamila Velieva's handlers for failed test

node.title: US defends embassy evacuation as Ukraine urges calm
node.description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken has said the "imminent" threat of Russian military action in Ukraine justifies evacuating the US embassy in Kyiv.

node.title: Pilot critically injured after plane crashes in north-eastern Tasmania
node.description: A man is critically injured when the plane he is piloting crashes into a paddock whilst fighting the Lebrina bushfire in Northern Tasmania.

node.title: NT Chief Minister denies government under-reporting of COVID-19 deaths, as hospitalisation numbers remain steady
node.description: Michael Gunner dismisses claims the NT is delaying or under-reporting Aboriginal deaths from the coronavirus, saying health services are taking longer so they do not make mistakes.

node.title: Man charged with murdering New Plymouth woman
node.description: A man has been charged with murdering a 48-year-old woman, who was discovered dead at her home in the New Plymouth suburb of Vogeltown today.

node.title: Former High Court judge's sexual harassment victims win historic compensation payout
node.description: The federal government has saluted the courage of the victims who came forward, saying their decision transformed the institution's workplace practices.

node.title: Fate of Russian figure skater hangs in balance after positive doping test
node.description: The Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) has concluded a six-hour hearing on Kamila Valieva after she tested positive for a banned drug.

node.title: SMEs bearing brunt of drop in economic activity
node.description: Activity in the services sector has slumped to start the year, as smaller firms struggle more than their larger counterparts.

node.title: St John of God in denial over abuse allegations - former nun
node.description: A clinical psychologist who met abuse survivors of the Catholic-run Marylands School in Christchurch in the early 2000s believes the St John of God Order was in denial there was even a problem.

node.title: Covid-19: People who don't need a test may be turned away - officials
node.description: People who are unlikely to have Covid-19 or who have not been advised to get tested risk being turned away from testing centres, Auckland public health officials say.

node.title: Call for Covid-19 isolation changes to help Pacific providers - expert
node.description: A Pasifika health expert says the number of Covid-19 cases and contacts isolating at home is already more than what health providers could keep up with in places like South Auckland.

node.title: Covid-19 update: Record 981 new community cases today
node.description: The Ministry of Health says "the further increase in new cases today is another reminder that, as expected, the highly transmissible Omicron variant is now spreading in our communities as we have seen…

node.title: Kaipara District Council eyes ocean discharge for Mangawhai wastewater
node.description: Kaipara District Council could potentially discharge treated wastewater into the ocean off Mangawhai as part of future sewerage infrastructure expansion for the country's fastest growing coastal…

node.title: Parking alternative offered to free up Parliament streets blocked by protesters
node.description: RNZ reporters say the streets are still blocked by cars and trucks that have been parked up illegally for days, and more tents are being set up in surrounding areas.

node.title: Firefighters battle scrub fire in Far North
node.description: Four helicopters and two firefighting crews are battling a blaze at Lake Ohia, in the Far North.

node.title: Woman Followed and Fatally Stabbed in Her Chinatown Apartment
node.description: Christina Yuna Lee was a creative producer at a digital music platform. The 25-year-old man arrested in her killing had a record of misdemeanor arrests.

node.title: SkyCity posts $33.7m first-half loss amid Covid-19 disruptions
node.description: The company, which operates the Auckland, Hamilton, Queenstown and Adelaide casinos, reported a net loss of $33.7 million for the six months ended December versus $77.9m in the year earlier.

node.title: Sadowski-Synnott chases gold number two
node.description: Snowboarder Zoi Sadowski-Synott begins her quest for a second Winter Olympic gold medal this afternoonn.

node.title: Less than 16% of the world's coastal regions remain intact, study says
node.description: The research found that more than half of the United States' coastal regions are under very high levels of human industrial pressure.

node.title: Eminem takes a knee during Super Bowl halftime show
node.description: While performing his classic hit "Lose Yourself" on Sunday night, the 15-time Grammy winner got on his knee and held his head.

node.title: New Zealander jailed for child sex abuse charges in US
node.description: A 28-year-old New Zealander has been jailed for 21 years in the United States for producing child sexual abuse material.

node.title: Auckland Mayor Phil Goff announces he will retire from politics
node.description: Auckland Mayor Phil Goff will retire from politics and says he will not be seeking re-election this year.

node.title: ‘Billions’ Season 6, Episode 4 Recap: Hungry Like the Wolf
node.description: Prince makes Kate an offer she can refuse. It’s just really hard to.

node.title: The ethereal Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron have a hefty edge.
node.description: By Jeré Longman

node.title: Right to protest lost for those who 'threaten, harass and disrupt', Robertson says
node.description: Deputy Prime Minister Grant Robertson says although people have a right to protest when "they threaten, harass and disrupt people and a whole city they lose that right".

node.title: Unvaccinated US man planning trip to NZ with illegally-obtained certificate
node.description: An unvaccinated man plans on travelling to New Zealand - and there's no way to tell he hasn't had the jab.
